IQ_WASI.Description: Score from abbreviated 2 scale IQ test from the Wechsler Abbreviated Scale of Intelligence (WASI). Citation: Wechsler, D. (2011). Wechsler Abbreviated Scale of Intelligence--Second Edition (WASI-II)

SES.Description: Socioeconomic Status (SES) reported by the child's parent. Citation: Hollingshead, A. (1975). Four-factor index of social status. New Haven, CT: Yale University.

RACE_MULTIPLERACES.Description: The participant has multiple racial identities

CONNERS_DSMIV_INATTENTIVE_T_SCORE.Description: DSM IV Inattentive scale T score from the Conners (3rd edition) Comprehensive Behavioral Rating Scale (CBRS) for parents. Citation: Conners, C. K., Pitkanen, J., & Rzepa, S. R. (2011). Conners 3rd Edition (Conners 3; Conners 2008). In J. S. Kreutzer, J. DeLuca, & B. Caplan (Eds.), Encyclopedia of Clinical Neuropsychology (pp. 675–678). Springer New York.

CONNERS_DSMIV_HYPER_IMPLS_T_SCORE.Description: DSM IV Hyperactive/Impulsive scale T score from the Conners (3rd edition) Comprehensive Behavioral Rating Scale (CBRS) for parents. Citation: Conners, C. K., Pitkanen, J., & Rzepa, S. R. (2011). Conners 3rd Edition (Conners 3; Conners 2008). In J. S. Kreutzer, J. DeLuca, & B. Caplan (Eds.), Encyclopedia of Clinical Neuropsychology (pp. 675–678). Springer New York.

ARIP6_TOTAL.Description: Total score on the parent-completed Affective Reactivity Index (ARI), with values ranging from 0 to 12. Citation: Stringaris A, Goodman R, Ferdinando S, Razdan V, Muhrer E, Leibenluft E, Brotman MA. The Affective Reactivity Index: a concise irritability scale for clinical and research settings. J Child Psychol Psychiatry. 2012 Nov;53(11):1109-17.

ARIY6_TOTAL.Description: Total score on the participant-completed Affective Reactivity Index (ARI), with values ranging from 0 to 12. Citation: Stringaris A, Goodman R, Ferdinando S, Razdan V, Muhrer E, Leibenluft E, Brotman MA. The Affective Reactivity Index: a concise irritability scale for clinical and research settings. J Child Psychol Psychiatry. 2012 Nov;53(11):1109-17.

SCARED_PAR_TOTAL_SCORE.Description: Total score on the Screen for Child Rated Anxiety Disorders (SCARED) for parents with values ranging from 0 to 82. Citation: Birmaher, B., Brent, D. A., Chiappetta, L., Bridge, J., Monga, S., & Baugher, M. (1999). Psychometric properties of the Screen for Child Anxiety Related Emotional Disorders (SCARED): a replication study. Journal of the American Academy of Child and Adolescent Psychiatry, 38(10), 1230–6.

SCARED_CH_TOTAL_SCORE.Description: Total score on the Screen for Child Rated Anxiety Disorders (SCARED) for children with values ranging from 0 to 82. Citation: Birmaher, B., Brent, D. A., Chiappetta, L., Bridge, J., Monga, S., & Baugher, M. (1999). Psychometric properties of the Screen for Child Anxiety Related Emotional Disorders (SCARED): a replication study. Journal of the American Academy of Child and Adolescent Psychiatry, 38(10), 1230–6.

CDI_TOTAL_SCORE.Description: Total score on the Children's Depression Inventory (CDI), with values ranging from 0 to 54. Citation: Kovacs M. (1985). The Children's Depression, Inventory (CDI). Psychopharmacology bulletin, 21(4), 995–998.

MED_ANTIPSYCHOTIC.Description: The participant takes atypical antipsychotic medication

MED_NONSTIMULANT.Description: The participant takes non-stimulant ADHD medication

MED_TRANQUILZER.Description: The participant takes a tranquilizer medication

MED_MOODSTABILIZER.Description: The participant takes a mood stabilizer medication

MEDLOAD.Description: Psychotropic medication load. Calculated from participant's current medications using guidelines proposed in Sackeim HA. The definition and meaning of treatment-resistant depression. J Clin Psychiatry. 2001;62 Suppl 16:10-7. PMID: 11480879.

DX_ANX.Description: The participant meets the criteria for an anxiety disorder using the Kiddie Schedule for Affective Disorders - Present and Lifetime Version (KSADS-PL). Citation: Kaufman J, Birmaher B, Brent D, Rao U, Flynn C, Moreci P, Williamson D, Ryan N. Schedule for Affective Disorders and Schizophrenia for School-Age Children-Present and Lifetime Version (K-SADS-PL): initial reliability and validity data. J Am Acad Child Adolesc Psychiatry. 1997 Jul;36(7):980-8.

DX_ADHD.Description: The participant meets the criteria for attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder using the ADHD supplement of the Kiddie Schedule for Affective Disorders - Present and Lifetime Version (KSADS-PL). Citation: Kaufman J, Birmaher B, Brent D, Rao U, Flynn C, Moreci P, Williamson D, Ryan N. Schedule for Affective Disorders and Schizophrenia for School-Age Children-Present and Lifetime Version (K-SADS-PL): initial reliability and validity data. J Am Acad Child Adolesc Psychiatry. 1997 Jul;36(7):980-8.

DX_DMDD.Description: The participant meets the criteria for disruptive mood dysregulation disorder (DMDD) using the DMDD supplement of the Kiddie Schedule for Affective Disorders - Present and Lifetime Version (KSADS-PL). Citation: Kaufman J, Birmaher B, Brent D, Rao U, Flynn C, Moreci P, Williamson D, Ryan N. Schedule for Affective Disorders and Schizophrenia for School-Age Children-Present and Lifetime Version (K-SADS-PL): initial reliability and validity data. J Am Acad Child Adolesc Psychiatry. 1997 Jul;36(7):980-8.

DX_ODD.Description: The participant meets the criteria for oppositional defiant disorder (ODD) using the Kiddie Schedule for Affective Disorders - Present and Lifetime Version (KSADS-PL). Citation: Kaufman J, Birmaher B, Brent D, Rao U, Flynn C, Moreci P, Williamson D, Ryan N. Schedule for Affective Disorders and Schizophrenia for School-Age Children-Present and Lifetime Version (K-SADS-PL): initial reliability and validity data. J Am Acad Child Adolesc Psychiatry. 1997 Jul;36(7):980-8.

DX_HV.Description: The participant is a healthy volunteer and does not meet the criteria for any psychiatric disorder using the Kiddie Schedule for Affective Disorders - Present and Lifetime Version (KSADS-PL). Citation: Kaufman J, Birmaher B, Brent D, Rao U, Flynn C, Moreci P, Williamson D, Ryan N. Schedule for Affective Disorders and Schizophrenia for School-Age Children-Present and Lifetime Version (K-SADS-PL): initial reliability and validity data. J Am Acad Child Adolesc Psychiatry. 1997 Jul;36(7):980-8.

COI_ED_NAT.Description: Child Opportunity Index 2.0 (COI) nationally-normed Education index. Source: https://www.diversitydatakids.org/sites/default/files/2020-02/ddk_coi2.0_technical_documentation_20200212.pdf.

COI_HE_NAT.Description: Child Opportunity Index 2.0 (COI) nationally-normed Health & Environment index. Source: https://www.diversitydatakids.org/sites/default/files/2020-02/ddk_coi2.0_technical_documentation_20200212.pdf.

COI_SE_NAT.Description: Child Opportunity Index 2.0 (COI) nationally-normed Social & Economic index. Source: https://www.diversitydatakids.org/sites/default/files/2020-02/ddk_coi2.0_technical_documentation_20200212.pdf.

COI_OVERALL_INDEX_NAT.Description: Child Opportunity Index 2.0 (COI) nationally-normed overall index score. Source: https://www.diversitydatakids.org/sites/default/files/2020-02/ddk_coi2.0_technical_documentation_20200212.pdf.

RUN1_FRUST.Description: Participant self-rated frustration following Affective Posner task run 1, from 1 ('not at all') to 9 ('extremely').

RUN1_SAD.Description: Participant self-rated sadness following Affective Posner task run 1, from 1 ('happy') to 9 ('sad').

RUN2_FRUST.Description: Participant self-rated frustration following Affective Posner task run 2, from 1 ('not at all') to 9 ('extremely').

RUN2_SAD.Description: Participant self-rated sadness following Affective Posner task run 2, from 1 ('happy') to 9 ('sad').

RUN3_FRUST.Description: Participant self-rated frustration following Affective Posner task run 3, from 1 ('not at all') to 9 ('extremely').

RUN3_SAD.Description: Participant self-rated sadness following Affective Posner task run 3, from 1 ('happy') to 9 ('sad').

RUN4_FRUST.Description: Participant self-rated frustration following Affective Posner task run 4, from 1 ('not at all') to 9 ('extremely').

RUN4_SAD.Description: Participant self-rated sadness following Affective Posner task run 4, from 1 ('happy') to 9 ('sad').
